thread.title: ANA’s Star Wars themed plane headed to Singapore
thread.title_full: ANA’s Star Wars themed plane headed to Singapore

title: ANA’s Star Wars themed plane headed to Singapore
text:
ANA’s Star Wars themed plane headed to Singapore Wednesday October 14, 2015 Print Article 
The first-ever commercial aircraft in the world to be decorated with Star Wars livery is coming to Changi Airport. — ANA pic SINGAPORE, Oct 14 – Star Wars fans here can now contend for a chance to enjoy a meal and a Star Wars movie in Business Class seats on a plane with a R2-D2 livery. 
Come Nov 12, Changi Airport will play host to the first commercial aircraft in the world to be decorated with a Star Wars livery. The ANA flight, dressed as the robust droid from Star Wars, is chartered by JTB Japan and will make a brief two-night stop here. 
The fan event will be held on Nov 14, whereby 40 winners of an online contest will live their Star Wars fantasy for three hours. 
Down to the details of headrests and dining ware, everything will be Star Wars themed, Changi Airport Group and ANA said today in a joint media release. Those on board can catch any one of the movies from episode 4 to 6 of the Star Wars saga, and will receive goodie bags filled with limited-edition commemorative merchandise such as an R2-D2TM ANA jet model plane and a Star Wars plush toy. 
The jet will be parked on the ground throughout the event. 
The contest is held on ANA’s website and Changi Airport’s Facebook page and will close on Oct 25. Twenty pairs of tickets are up for grabs. Five pairs will be selected by Changi Airport Group and 15 pairs will be selected by ANA. 
Launched last month in Japan, the flight is the first in a series of three Star Wars themed planes by ANA and The Walt Disney Company (Japan). 
In addition to domestic routes, the R2-D2 ANA jet has been scheduled to fly from Tokyo to Vancouver, Seattle, San Jose, Munich, Paris, Brussels, Sydney, Beijing and Jakarta. — TODAY
